response.job_title: Master's Degree in Water Resources Engineering and Civil Engineer | P.Eng. license eligible and applicant | Water Engineering | Wastewater Engineering | Hydraulic | Bilingual English French | BIM
response.summary: Master's degree in water resources and civil engineer. With 10+ years of experience managing and providing design expertise for drainage, stormwater management, and water distribution systems in municipal and private projects and developments. Known as a confident communicator and highly qualified lead engineer, applying sustainability concepts, advanced software tools, and BIM methodology. P.Eng. license eligible and applicant. Solid proficiency in English, French, and Spanish languages.
response.skills: HEC-HMS, PCSWMM (Software), Project Planning, BIM Software,  P.Eng., Stormwater Management, drainage developments, P.Eng, Hydrology, Water Resource Engineering, Engineering, Building Information Modeling (BIM), Civil Engineering, Water Treatment, Water Resource Management, Wastewater Treatment, Microsoft Office, Servicio de atención al cliente, AutoCAD, AutoCAD Civil 3D

profile_positions.description:
• Identified optimal product solutions for specific projects, offering expert advice on installation recommendations and procedures, Specialized in stormwater management designs, municipal and private drainage developments, and industrial building drainage, among other areas.
• Performed comprehensive hydraulic calculations and offered valuable information and advice to ensure effective problem-solving and client satisfaction. Actively visit problem sites when necessary to address challenges promptly and maintain high client service levels.
• Delivered design services for individual projects, including creating layout drawings, parts lists, and shop drawings. Provided materials list for customer service or the distributors. Assumed the "Project Coordinator" role for significant projects, taking charge of planning, scheduling, gathering, verifying, and communicating project information to relevant stakeholders.
• Managed and supported cross-provincial teams operating in Ontario, British Columbia, Quebec, Alberta, Manitoba, Saskatchewan, and Nova Scotia. Supervise the generation of bills of materials and technical outputs by sales teams, ensuring adherence to codes, maintaining consistency, and upholding quality engineering practices. 
• Overseed and maintained the computerized drafting system, ensuring its smooth operation and functionality. Managed the Technical Services Information database, ensuring accurate and up-to-date information for seamless workflow. Identified areas of improvement within the Technical Department and collaborated with Corporate Management to implement enhancements.
profile_positions.title: Water Technical Support Specialist

profile_positions.description:
• Led and overseed water resources consulting projects related to water supply, stormwater, and wastewater systems in civil developments and plumbing and sewage installations in building projects. 
• Participate in multi-disciplinary teams that collaborating in projects across Colombia. Provided consulting input to project schedules and participate in the design and construction stages.
• Provide technical leadership to junior and intermediate staff, including validating work over designs, and ensuring the successful execution of projects.
• Manage and support the development, training and growth of a team of hydrologists, water resource specialists and technicians.
• Overseeing the planning and design of various project elements, the preparation of project reports, hydraulic models, calculations, drawings, construction plans and specifications, permitting packages, and documents for inclusion in the final project deliverables.
• Conducted comprehensive hydrological, hydraulic, and sanitation studies at the national level. Utilized advanced methodologies and tools to analyze data, assess risks, and optimize water resource management strategies, both locally and regionally.
profile_positions.title: Water Resources Manager

profile_positions.description: Programming and updating of curricular contents, coordination of teachers related to the field, coordination and execution of academic events of interest to the program, and teaching of subjects related to hydraulics and sanitation, of the Civil Engineering, on the Cajicá Campus.
profile_positions.title: Hydraulics and sanitation’s field chief - Teacher

profile_positions.description: Professor of Supply and sewerage design, Hydrology, Hydraulics and Research seminary in the Civil Engineering program.
profile_positions.title: Part-time teacher

profile_positions.description:
• Conducted hydraulic and hydrological studies, as well as water demand and scarcity assessments. Skillfully interpreted and analyzed model input and outputs to derive meaningful insights.
• Performed and coordinated the entire process of major water projects, including modeling, research, design, quality control, and overall execution.
• Designed water systems in buildings and designed urban planning networks associated with road infrastructure and urban management projects at the national level. 
• Prepared reports, calculation reports, construction plans, and estimates of material quantities.
• Undertake field work as necessary and/or manage/oversee completion of field work by junior staff.
• Represented the firm with responsible authorities. local municipal and regional regulations for water resources engineering
profile_positions.title: Hydraulic Network Specialist

profile_positions.description: Professor of Quality and Water Treatment and Fluid and Hydraulic Mechanics courses in the Environmental Engineering program.
profile_positions.title: Part-time teacher

profile_positions.description:
• Coordinated and carried out hydrological, hydraulic, and erosion studies in developing refurbishment, maintenance, and construction of road projects at the Colombian national scope. 
• Prepared, wrote, and presented technical reports, calculation reports, budgets, and technical concepts for these projects.
• Harmonized work, arranged meetings, and presented projects to clients and relevant authorities.
• Conduct field investigation of drainage infrastructure.
profile_positions.title: Hydraulic specialist

profile_positions.description:
• Supervise, coordinate, and conduct the hydraulic department's projects. Complete conceptual engineering, feasibility assessment, and evaluation of alternative technologies for water resources infrastructure.
• Prepare and review preliminary, detailed, and tender drawings, designs and plans, calculations, and technical assessments.
• Written reports and calculations developed engineering designs and drawings and represented the company with customers and suppliers.
profile_positions.title: Engineer of Hydraulic Design

company.name: WSP in Canada
company.description: WSP Canada delivers local solutions to its clients backed by international expertise. Our company features more than 12,000 technical experts and strategic advisors in Canada, and 67,000 around the world, including engineers, technicians, scientists, planners, landscape architects and urban designers, surveyors, and environmental specialists, as well as other design, program and construction management professionals. Working across the Transportation and Infrastructure, Earth and Environment, Property and Buildings and Energy, Resources and Industry sectors, our staff is dedicated to creating results that are resilient, sustainable, and climate-conscious, benefitting our communities for generations.
